item.title: Cap (Easy) Writeup
item.description:
Introduction Link to heading

This is a writeup for the HTB machine “Cap”. It’s user rated to be easy and is a great entry level box.

This machine focuses on unrestricted URL directories, unsecure login details, and basic vulnerability enumeration on the target machine. Let’s dive into the machine and look at how we could approach it.

Enumeration Link to heading

Initial Recon Link to heading

To start with, we’ll do our basic nmap scans of the machine. For something this simple, we don’t need to overcomplicate it.

item.title: root@kali:~$ whoami
item.description:
üêß tfr ‚Äî Cybersecurity Penguin Link to heading

Hey! I‚Äôm Cameron, but I go by tfr online.
I break things, fix things, reverse things, and occasionally ask penguins about if I’m ready for the OSCP+. 1

This blog is mostly just for me to write about my current focuses, projects, machines I’m working or anything really. I’ve been gifted with a brain of many interests but cursed to a life with little time so I tend to work on a few things at once. My hope is that this blog will help me stay committed and finish things I start, rather than just learning what I need and leaving it behind.
